review: I recommend Signal. I was a fan of Telegram, but after the owner, Pavel Durov, was arrested in Paris and basically folded and IA now cooperating with governments and handing over user information to them, stopped using it as much. I don't do anything illegal on Telegram. But the whole draw of it was that it was supposed to be "secure" and didn't save or give info to government. Yah, it supposed to be only giving info on "bad actors" but that's where it starts.
Every time I install Telegram app and log in, my Google account is synced from an unknown person's number to that person's Telegram account, and that's how it got hacked.
reply: Please make sure to never share your login codes with anyone, and avoid using 3rd party / unofficial apps. You can go to Settings > Devices in Telegram to see where your account is logged in and terminate any suspicious devices there. You can also add an extra password for your account in Settings > Privacy and Security > Two-Step Verification.
